text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
Describes the Appeals Inventory Validation Process (AIVP).
Describes and incorporates guidance related to implementation of the AIVP programming in the Appeals Centralized Database System (ACDS).
Describes and provides requirements and procedures for using the Validation Tracking System (VTS).
Describes and provides requirements and procedures for using the Validation Tracking Log (VTL).
Describes methods for conducting a physical inventory validation.
Provides guidance for Appeals Area Directors to determine the method their Areas will use to conduct physical inventory validations.
Explains ways to conduct a physical validation of an Appeals Technical Employee’s inventory.
Describes and provides requirements and procedures for using the Appeals Drawer to List Inventory Validation Report (AD
LIV).
Explains ways to conduct a physical validation of Account and Processing Support (APS) inventory and a Tax Examiner’s inventory.
Removes the requirement to report physical inventory results to the Director, Policy, Quality Case Support. Requires Area Directors to report physical inventory results to their respective Director.
ON OTHER DOCUMENTS This supersedes IRM 8.10.3 dated August 31, 2012.
John V. Cardone Director, Policy, Quality and Case Support
Table of
Exhibits
Managerial Certification Memorandum
Missing Case Report
Inventory Validation Process 8.10.3
(10-01-2015) Appeals Inventory Validation Process (AIVP)
) Validating inventory, statute dates, and database accuracy involves both automated and physical validation methods. (cid:

) Automated validation of critical data fields is accomplished through the Validation Tracking System (VTS), which systemically requires users to perform case validations throughout the life cycle of each case in inventory. (cid:

) Physical validation is accomplished through physical inspection of case files and is conducted as an “ACDS Drawer-to-List Validation”. Taking into consideration resources and budget constraints, each Area Director can approve the use of an alternative method to conduct physical valida- tions. Examples of alternative methods include: physical validation of a statistically valid sample of cases, physical validation of all or part of the inventory of one or more co-located employees, delegating physical tion to a proxy, or any other method approved by the Area Director. Team Managers (ATM) and Processing Team Managers (PTM) are sible for completing the physical validation process jointly with their employees who are assigned an inventory of cases. For the purpose of ciency managers could also complete an annual “ACDS Drawer-to-List Validation” validation in conjunction with a workload review when (

) The VTS was designed to make it easier to achieve data accuracy and improve the data quality of the ACDS database. The VTS systemically validation at various designated points in the life cycle of all cases in inventory. (

) The VTS allows users to confirm that the data in ACDS is accurate at the of validation. If an update is needed, the user may update, change or modify entries in any of the current critical data fields they have permission to See IRM
) for a list of critical data fields by position and type. All updates, changes or modifications made to critical data fields the VTS post on ACDS immediately. (
) The system requires validation of critical data fields at the following desig- nated points in the life cycle of the case: (cid:
) Case receipt (card-in)

) Physical validation is accomplished through physical inspection of case files and is conducted as an “ACDS Drawer-to-List Validation”. Taking into consideration resources and budget constraints, each Area Director can approve the use of an alternative method to conduct physical valida- tions. Examples of alternative methods include: physical validation of a statistically valid sample of cases, physical validation of all or part of the inventory of one or more co-located employees, delegating physical valida- tion to a proxy, or any other method approved by the Area Director. Team Managers (ATM) and Processing Team Managers (PTM) are respon- sible for completing the physical validation process jointly with their employees who are assigned an inventory of cases. For the purpose of ciency managers could also complete an annual “ACDS Drawer-to-List Validation” validation in conjunction with a workload review when possible.

) The VTS was designed to make it easier to achieve data accuracy and improve the data quality of the ACDS database. The VTS systemically validation at various designated points in the life cycle of all cases in Appeals inventory. (

) The VTS allows users to confirm that the data in ACDS is accurate at the time of validation. If an update is needed, the user may update, change or modify entries in any of the current critical data fields they have permission to See IRM
) for a list of critical data fields by position and validation type. All updates, changes or modifications made to critical data fields through the VTS post on ACDS immediately. (
) The system requires validation of critical data fields at the following desig- nated points in the life cycle of the case: (cid:

) A critical data field is an ACDS data field identified as essential to ensuring Appeals’ data is accurate and reliable. A data field is designated critical by Data Field headquarters. (

) A document listing Critical Data Fields by position and validation type is on the Appeals website. Use the hyperlink in this paragraph or navigate to document from the Appeals “Home” page by clicking on Strategy & (Business Systems Planning) Webpage → All Applications (under the “Applications”) → AIVP VTS → Critical Data Fields (under the heading “Resources”). (
) Users are required to make a determination as to the nature of the change a critical data field and designate a reason code: Codes (cid:
) Normal Update (N) - No one is “charged” with an error when a change designated as a normal update. (cid:
) Error Correction (E) - The prior team in possession of the case is “charged” with an error when a change is designated as an error (
) Reason codes are captured as part of the ACDS data accuracy calculation reports. (
) A normal update is a change to a critical data field that is required as part normal case management. Examples of normal updates include: Update (cid:
) Changing an address because the taxpayer or the representative while the case was in process (cid:
) Changing the statute date or code because you executed a statute extension (cid:
) Changing the statute date or code because you received an agreement during the
-day period (cid:
) Changing the statute date or code because of an event or tax law, such bankruptcy or TEFRA, (cid:
) Removing Tax Period Modifier “N” because you received the original (cid:
) Adding Tax Period Modifier “N” because the original return was copied refiled (cid:
) Removing a Feature Code because the feature no longer applies, such when a case is no longer a “Quick Look” case. (

) An error correction is a change to a critical data field because information the system is not accurate based on source documents in your This could be due to a incorrect determination or an input error. Examples error corrections include: (cid:
) Changing data due to key stroke errors (cid:
) Changing the statute date or code due to statute determination errors (cid:
) Adding Tax Period Modifier “N” if the original return was not in the file (cid:
) Removing Tax Period Modifier “N” if present and the original return was the file Internal Revenue Manual Cat. No.

Inventory Validation Process 8.10.3

page Note: An input error does not mean it’s an APS input error. Because the VTS allows others to input changes to critical data fields, the error is charged to the prior team in possession of the case. (

) An ACDS Update Request Form is available on APGolf to use to make an ACDS update request to APS. The VTS eliminates the need for most ACDS update requests to APS. The ATE must update critical data fields on their assigned cases from the VTS unless the case is in APS’ possession. APS reject ACDS update requests that the ATE is required to make. When an update to ACDS is needed that cannot be made through the VTS, APS will make the update to ACDS upon receipt of an ACDS Update Request Form. See IRM

, ACDS and AIMS Update and Correction Procedures, for procedures and timeframes for APS to complete the ACDS update. Note: To update a non-timesheet case through the VTS, access the validations menu by clicking the “Validations” button at the bottom of the “search case results screen”. Non-timesheet cases are not accessible from CARATS. timesheet cases are related records linked to timesheet cases with the workunit number. (

) If an ACDS update made through the VTS requires APS to make an update another related system (for example, ISTS), submit an update request to using the appropriate form or format for the related system. (

) All of the validation screens display the current data on the system for each critical data field in a column headed “Original Data.” The person validating case makes changes to critical data fields in the column headed “Data” by either entering new data in write-in fields or making a selection from a drop- down list, if one is provided. For each change made, the user must check a box to indicate whether the change was a “normal update” or “error See IRM
, Reason Codes. (
) All of the validation screens provide the user with options to:
Save Draft and Exit - this option allows the user to save changes as a draft and exit the screen and return later to complete the validation. Any changes saved as draft will remain on the system for

calendar days from the date of the last update saved as draft. Only the person who saved the draft can view the draft. A dialog box will appear after the user clicks the button to confirm that the validation was saved as a draft. OK to Exit the validation screen.

Validate - this option submits the user’s changes, or, if no changes were made, validates that the information on the system is accurate. The should click the Validate button only after reviewing all data on the and determining that it’s correct. After the user clicks the “Validate” the system displays a message confirming that the validation was suc- cessful. When Validate is clicked, the change is immediately written to ACDS. New CARATS Action Code VA is systemically generated when a validation is submitted.

Cancel - this option deletes all changes input on the screen and returns the user to the previous screen. A dialog box appears warning the user the change will not be saved, asking, “Are you sure you want to exit
Note: An input error does not mean it’s an APS input error. Because the VTS allows others to input changes to critical data fields, the error is charged to the prior team in possession of the case.

An ACDS Update Request Form is available on APGolf to use to make an ACDS update request to APS. The VTS eliminates the need for most ACDS update requests to APS. The ATE must update critical data fields on their assigned cases from the VTS unless the case is in APS’ possession. APS will reject ACDS update requests that the ATE is required to make. When an update to ACDS is needed that cannot be made through the VTS, APS will make the update to ACDS upon receipt of an ACDS Update Request Form. See IRM
, ACDS and AIMS Update and Correction Procedures, for the procedures and timeframes for APS to complete the ACDS update.
Save Draft and Exit - this option allows the user to save changes as a draft and exit the screen and return later to complete the validation. Any changes saved as draft will remain on the system for

calendar days from the date of the last update saved as draft. Only the person who saved the draft can view the draft. A dialog box will appear after the user clicks the button to confirm that the validation was saved as a draft. Click OK to Exit the validation screen.

Validate - this option submits the user’s changes, or, if no changes were made, validates that the information on the system is accurate. The user should click the Validate button only after reviewing all data on the screen and determining that it’s correct. After the user clicks the “Validate” the system displays a message confirming that the validation was suc- cessful. When Validate is clicked, the change is immediately written to ACDS. New CARATS Action Code VA is systemically generated when a validation is submitted.

Cancel - this option deletes all changes input on the screen and returns the user to the previous screen. A dialog box appears warning the user the change will not be saved, asking, “Are you sure you want to exit
changes and return to the previous screen. Click “No” and the screen remains available for updates. Print
this option allows users to print the validation screen. The print button is located in the top right hand corner of the screen. Help
this option opens a pop
up window that explains the validation process. The button is located next to the print option in the top right hand corner of the screen.

in process, and will complete a “Create Case” validation in ACDS prior to sending the case to the Appeals Team Manager (ATM) for assignment or the Processing Team Manager (PTM) for sample b. Appeals Technical Employees (ATEs) are required to validate case infor

) When a non-APS user completes a validation that includes a change to a statute date or statute code on a tax period with an AIMS Indicator “Y” on ACDS, the system: a. Selects the user’s default PTM but allows the user to change the selection, if needed, and b. Creates a new PEAS case with PEAS Type = AIVP/Sub Type = AIMS the selected PTM’s inbox. The systemic creation of an unassigned PEAS case ensures the IDRS date/code update will be assigned to an APS TE. (
) ATEs will ensure all assigned cases are properly controlled on ACDS (
) ATEs will validate critical data fields (CDF) using the Validation Tracking System (VTS). Once validated, ACDS updates made through VTS will immediately. (

) for a listing of all fields available for updates in (

) ATEs may access the validations menu for their assigned cases by clicking “Validations” link from CARATS or the “Validations” button at the bottom of search case results screen. Some menu options may be “grayed out” or not listed when not systemically required. You must complete systemically validations when required or the system will prevent subsequent updates. days. (cid:

) ATE - Statute - this option available at any time and includes statute- related critical data fields open to the ATE for edit (

) The ATE will directly update all available critical data fields through the VTS. The ATE will designate each change identified as part of the validation as either a Normal Update (N) or an Error Correction (E). Internal Revenue Manual

8.10.3.3.8 (10-01-2015) Appeals Technical Employee (ATE) Validations

Note: See IRM 8.10.3.3.1 (2) for a listing of all fields available for updates in VTS.

8.10 Appeals Reports and
) When a change is required that is not part of the VTS critical data fields, the ATE will prepare and submit an ACDS Update request to APS, identifying the required update, change or modification. (
) An Anniversary Validation is required when a case has been open in the Appeals inventory for more than
days. The Anniversary Validation the Appeals annual inventory validation requirement to review each case at least once every
days and is an opportunity to ensure ACDS data matches information in the source documents. (

) A system notification alerts the ATE that an Assignment validation is required. No further action can be taken on the case until the Anniversary Validation is completed, for each case in the work unit. (
) If there has not been a previous validation of the case, both the Assignment and Anniversary validations may be required. (
) An Anniversary Validation is not required if any of the following conditions are met: (cid:
) The ATE completed the Assignment Validation within the previous
(cid:
) The CAR shows AC/FR or AC/OD entry (cid:
) The case shows ACAPDATE entry (cid:
) The case is assigned in PEAS (cid:
) The case has a DATECLSD and closing code <
or =

) The Validation Tracking Log (VTL) lists all validations submitted on a case and can be used to interpret changes to critical data fields. All ACDS users have read-only access to the VTL. (

) To access the VTL, select the case from search results, then click on the VTL button for that case at the bottom of the search case screen. There are various other VTL entry points in ACDS, depending upon the user’s permissions. (

) The VTL displays data for one case at a time and includes the history of critical data field changes made through the VTS. You can view or print detailed information about each validation by clicking on the“plus” sign to expand the data for the validation type listed.
8.10 Appeals Reports and

) Physical validation is accomplished through physical inspection of case Physical validation is performed to ensure cases and tax returns assigned to in the possession of employees for resolution of tax matters are established, processed or controlled on ACDS. A physical validation identifies: a. Cases in possession of an Appeals employee but not controlled on b. Cases controlled on ACDS but not in the possession of an Appeals employee. c. Erroneous statute of limitation dates and/or codes. (

) The physical validation process is commonly referred to as a validation. Each fiscal year, Appeals Team Managers (ATM) and Processing Team Managers (PTM), in collaboration with their employees who are an inventory of cases, are responsible for conducting a physical validation. efficiency, managers could complete the physical validation in conjunction a workload review when possible. Note: Physical inventory validation does not relieve employees of statute tion upon receipt of the case as outlined in IRM
, General Statute Responsibility. (
) ATMs can use the “ACDS Drawer-to-List Validation (AD

LIV)” to conduct physical IVL in collaboration with their employees. The term Appeals Employee (ATE) includes all employees who are assigned cases and tax returns on ACDS for resolution of tax matters. See IRM
for a of Appeals Technical Employee. (

) PTMs can use the “PEAS Inventory List” to conduct a physical IVL in ration with their employees. The term Tax Examiner (TE) includes all employees who are assigned cases to establish, process or control on (
) Area Directors can approve using an alternative method to conduct physical validations. (
) The Appeals Drawer to List Inventory Validation Report (AD
LIV) is located the Appeals Team Manager Functions menu. to List (
) The “Appeals Drawer to List Inventory Validation Report (AD

LIV)” was designed for ATMs to use when conducting a drawer-to-list physical IVL of cases assigned to and in the possession of an ATE. It can be worked on- screen from ACDS without printing until the validation is completed. (
) Validate cases from the drawer to the list. Pull each administrative file in the ATE’s possession and compare it to the listing. Note: Do not validate from the list to the drawer. (
) When the report is initially displayed, the “Validated” checkbox will be for any case that has had an “ATM - Workload Review Validation” within the last
days by the ATM running the report. (
) To validate a case, click on the TPNAME hyperlink to open the “ATM - Workload Review Validation” for the case. (
) At a minimum, validate the accuracy of the following required critical data (CDFs):
Validate cases from the drawer to the list. Pull each administrative file in the ATE’s possession and compare it to the listing.

) When you are returned to the report after clicking “Validate,” a check mark will appear in the “Validated” check box for the case. If you change one of the following CDFs, you will see the change when you are returned to the report: (cid:
) TAXPAYER (cid:

Inventory Validation Process 8.10.3
Generate a current ACDS ATE Case Inventory Listing as follows:
APS inventory consists of assigned and unassigned inventory. APS conducts physical inventory validations using a variety of reports and methods, including:
Validation Tracking System - APS validates cases using the VTS when required by the system throughout the life cycle of the case.
PEAS Inventory List - The PTM can use this report to conduct a physical inventory validation of assigned cases with the Tax Examiner, preferably during a workload review.

Other inventory validation related reports - APS generates and works inventory validation related reports related to controlling the physical location of assigned and unassigned cases and statutes, as required in IRM
, Appeals Reports and Projects, Internal Reports..

(1) Generate a current PEAS Inventory List as follows: List Step Action Required 1 Access the “PEAS Inventory List” located under APS→Reports→IVL 2 Select the employee from the drop-down list 3 Select “Just Cases in Inventory” 4 Sort by TPNAME 5 Check the box to “Include open PEAS cases with no open returns” (2) In addition to the PTM using this list for the physical IVL, the TE may generate and work this report on an as needed basis. (1) As required in IRM 8.10.1, Appeals Reports and Projects, Internal Reports , APS generates and works a variety of case inventory reports. The following Inventory Reports case inventory reports and report parameters are also used for physical inventory validation: (cid:129) ACDS Unassigned Report – Select the 2nd option and then select Action
